intro: Lythrum anceps, commonly known as narrow-leaved catchfly, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes plants known for their showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and range in color from pink to red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lythrum anceps is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along streambanks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
